UNDERSTANDING THE NEED FOR AGILE We've lately been examining different aspects of agile—from user stories to velocity to backlog refinement—but now we’re ready to look at the agile origin story. In the first post of his new series, agile coach Jeremy Jarrell looks at where the methodology came from, its growing pains, and some of the ways we use it today. https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/understanding-the-need-for-agile/
VELOCITY IS A MEASURE OF PACE, NOT PRODUCTIVITY While there are perfectly good reasons teams use velocity to measure an individual developer’s workload, it runs counter to agile philosophy. This post examines why Tracker doesn’t do it, and looks at how to use velocity to encourage predictability in teams. https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/velocity-is-a-measure-of-pace-not-productivity
WEBINAR: GETTING IN SHAPE FOR 2018: PRODUCT MANAGEMENT BEST PRACTICES Thursday, Dec 14, 11am PST How did your roadmap work out this year? Does your backlog need pruning? The Product Stack returns with another free webinar designed to get you set up for 2018. Learn why it’s important to clean out your backlog and get organized, how to become a better product planner and prioritize the right initiatives, and what it takes to make your next product management career move. https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/3340380483908130049?source=Tracker
GUIDELINES FOR MASTERING AGILE DEVELOPMENT Certain agile practices—like standups, IPMs, and story estimation—become ingrained over time, but other core concepts can get overlooked. We put together this list of Agile guidelines to fill in those gaps and make your Tracker experience all the more successful. https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/guidelines-for-mastering-agile-development-with-tracker/
MANAGING MULTIPLE RELATED PROJECTS As your team grows, your product matures, and your tasks become overwhelming, managing your software development projects can make your head spin. Here’s how the Tracker Team uses workspaces to stop the spinning. https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/tracking-multiple-related-projects/
FREE DOWNLOAD: PRESENT! A TECHIE'S GUIDE TO PUBLIC SPEAKING Giving a presentation and having all eyes on you can make a body nervous, but sometimes you just have to do it. Luckily for us, Poornima Vijayashanker and Karen Catlin wrote Present! A Techie’s Guide to Public Speaking, which offers plenty of tips for overcoming this anxiety and mastering your presentations. And for a limited time, we’re offering a free download of the ebook! https://pivotaltracker.com/blog/free-download-of-present-techie's-guide-to-public-speaking/
REDISCOVER TRACKER Tracker has a host of new features–from blockers, emoji, and profile photos, to a native Android app. But the best way to see what's new is to jump back into Tracker and experience it firsthand. https://pivotaltracker.com/features
